page.title: 13ENTERTAINMENT IN LLANBISTER
page.content: The lack of cinemas and theatres and the poor quality T.V. reception has encouraged the continuation of alternative entertainment. This usually takes the form of a group activity or sport. During the winter months most groups hold their annual dinner in hotels. These are usually followed by a dance or games. A charity dinner dance is organised by ladies from the village.Whist drives are popular with players traveling great distances to play. Hunting is also a winter activity. Sports include Rounders, Darts and Dominoes played in leagues.Tug o War, an international sport.Car treasure hunts, Clay Pigeon shooting, Pony trotting run through the summer. A recent innovation is the twice weekly visit by the video hire van.The library van calls once a fortnight.
